TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

Since DATE the applicant had been registered as an unemployed person . ORG ( PERSON työttömyyskassa , PERSON arbetslöshetskassa , “ the Fund ” ) granted him an unemployment allowance by CARDINAL decisions issued in DATE , DATE and DATE .
On DATE , a representative of the Fund informed the police that it intended to report an offence by the applicant for allegedly having obtained unemployment allowances by fraud .
On DATE , the ORG filed a criminal complaint . The applicant was interrogated by the police for the first time on DATE .

On DATE , the ORG , using an extraordinary procedure , requested ORG ( vakuutusoikeus , försäkringsdomstolen ) to annul the ORG ’s decisions in DATE , DATE and DATE to pay an unemployment allowance to the applicant . It referred to a statement of ORG of DATE , according to which the applicant had been self - employed since DATE .

On DATE , having received the applicant ’s observations , ORG annulled the ORG ’s decisions and sent the case back to it for fresh consideration . CARDINAL of the judges deciding on the case was M.T. The Insurance Court ’s legal officer ( referendaire ) noted in his / her memorandum that “ Furthermore , the Fund reported an offence by [ the applicant ] , which led to a police investigation . Apparently no charges have been lodged yet . ”

On DATE and DATE , the ORG issued CARDINAL decisions , by which it considered , inter alia , that it had paid the applicant unwarranted unemployment allowances and training allowances during various periods DATE and ordered him to repay them , in a total amount of MONEY ( ORG , MONEY ( ORG ) ) .

On DATE , the applicant appealed to ORG ( työttömyysturvalautakunta , arbetslöshetsnämnden ) . Having obtained observations from the parties , ORG upheld the ORG ’s decisions on DATE as far as they concerned unemployment allowances paid DATE .

On DATE , the applicant appealed to ORG . He denied having had any business activity during DATE he received unemployment allowances . He also requested an oral hearing . On DATE ORG asked the applicant whether he wished to maintain his request for an oral hearing , and if so , to name his witnesses . It further informed the applicant that the provisions of the LAW on Cost - free Trial ( laki maksuttomasta oikeudenkäynnistä , lag om DATE rättegång ) would not apply to the proceedings . According to the applicant , he subsequently informed the court that he would not request an oral hearing as he could not afford the costs .
On DATE , the applicant requested the court to speed up the proceedings .

On DATE , ORG upheld the decision save for repayment of unemployment allowance which he had received before DATE to which a common period of limitation of DATE applied . Judge PERSON sat on the bench . The decision was final in that the applicant did not have a right to appeal against it under the domestic law .

Subsequently , on DATE , the applicant , using an extraordinary procedure , requested ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) to annul ORG decision for procedural error , alleging that PERSON was biased as he had decided on the case both in DATE and in DATE . He further alleged that he had been denied a right to an oral hearing as he could not obtain legal aid .

Having issued interim measures , ORG rejected most of the applicant ’s requests on DATE . It however examined his application about the alleged bias of PERSON , finding no grounds to believe that PERSON had been partial in deciding the applicant ’s case twice . It reasoned , inter alia , that the legal nature of the CARDINAL cases was different and found that PERSON did not have any preconceived ideas that would have cast doubt on his impartiality when the second decision was taken .
